intro: Verbascum hajastanicum, commonly known as the Caucasian mullein, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
